1:
The proverbs of Solomon.\q A wise son makes his father rejoice
\q but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
\q
2:
Treasures accumulated by wickedness have no value,\q but doing what is right keeps you from death.
\q
3:
Yahweh does not let the soul of the righteous person go hungry,\q but he frustrates the cravings of the wicked.


\q
4:
A lazy hand causes a person to be poor,\q but the hand of the diligent person gains riches.
\q
5:
A wise son gathers a crop in the summer,\q but it is disgraceful for him to sleep during harvest.


\q
6:
Gifts from God are upon the head of the righteous person,\q but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.
\q
7:
The righteous person makes those who remember him happy,\q but the name of the wicked will rot away.


\q
8:
Those who are sensible accept commands,\q but a talkative fool will come to ruin.
\q
9:
He who walks in integrity walks in safety,\q but the one who makes his ways crooked, he will be found out.


\q
10:
He who winks the eye causes grief,\q but a talkative fool will be thrown down.
\f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa but one who bravely corrects makes peace \fqa* . \f*
\q
11:
The mouth of the righteous person is a water spring of life,\q but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.


\q
12:
Hatred stirs up conflicts,\q but love covers over all offenses.
\q
13:
Wisdom is found on the lips of a discerning person,\q but a rod is for the back of the one who has no sense.


\q
14:
Wise men store up knowledge,\q but the mouth of a fool brings destruction near.
\q
15:
The wealth of a rich man is his fortified city;\q the poverty of the poor is their destruction.


\q
16:
The wage of the righteous person leads to life;\q the profit of the wicked leads them to sin.
\q
17:
There is a path to life for the one who follows discipline,\q but the one who rejects correction is led astray.

\q
18:
Whoever conceals hatred has lying lips,\q and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
\q
19:
When there are many words, transgression is not lacking,\q but he who is careful in what he says is wise.


\q
20:
The tongue of the righteous person is pure silver;\q there is little value in the heart of the wicked.
\q
21:
The lips of the righteous person nourish many,\q but fools die because of their lack of sense.


\q
22:
The good gifts of Yahweh bring wealth\q and he adds no pain to it.
\q
23:
Wickedness is a game a fool plays,\q but wisdom is a pleasure to a man of understanding.


\q
24:
The fear of the wicked person will overtake him,\q but the desire of righteous people will be granted.
\q
25:
The wicked are like the storm that passes by, and they are no more,\q but the righteous person is a foundation that lasts forever.


\q
26:
Like vinegar on the teeth and smoke in the eyes,\q so is the sluggard to those who send him.
\q
27:
The fear of Yahweh prolongs life,\q but the years of the wicked will be short.


\q
28:
The hope of righteous people is their joy,\q but the years of wicked people will be short.
\q
29:
The way of Yahweh protects those who have integrity,\q but it is destruction for the wicked.
\q
30:
The righteous person will never be overthrown,\q but the wicked will not remain in the land.


\q
31:
Out of the mouth of the righteous person comes the fruit of wisdom,\q but the perverse tongue will be cut out.
\q
32: The lips of the righteous person know what is acceptable,\q but the mouth of the wicked, they know what is perverse.
